analyzed: nga'i sku 'di lta bu ni dam pa'i chos bsrungs ba'i bsod nams kyi rgyus 'grub pa yin no //
translated: This kind of body of mine is attained by the merit of protecting the holy Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i dge bsnyen gyis ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i dge bsnyen gyis ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, a lay practitioner who protects the holy Dharma should not take the five precepts.

original: dge bsnyen gyi 'dul ba yang spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi 'dul ba yang spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not practice the Vinaya of the lay practitioner.

original: tshul khrims dang / cho ga dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i dge slong rnams bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / cho ga dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'i dge slong rnams bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to protect the monks who have moral discipline, ritual purity, and good qualities,

original: mda' gzhu dang / ral gri dang / mdung thung kha leb lag tu thogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mda' gzhu dang / ral gri dang / mdung thung kha leb lag tu thogs par bya'o //
translated: they should carry bows and arrows, swords, and spears in their hands.

original: gsol pa / dge slong dag las srung ma dang lhan cig mi 'khod par gcig pu shing drung du stan bting ba la mchis pa gang lags pa de dag ni dge slong zhes bgyi ba lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / dge slong dag las srung ma dang lhan cig mi 'khod par gcig pu shing drung du stan bting ba la mchis pa gang lags pa de dag ni dge slong zhes bgyi ba lags so //
translated: He said, “Those monks who do not sit together with their bodyguards, but sit alone under a tree on a prepared seat, they are the ones who are called monks.

original: srung ma dang lhan cig 'khod pa gang lags pa de dag ni khyim bdag mgo reg ces bgyi ba lags so //
analyzed: srung ma dang lhan cig 'khod pa gang lags pa de dag ni khyim bdag mgo reg ces bgyi ba lags so //
translated: Those who sit together with their bodyguards, they are called householder-monks.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu khyim bdag mgo reg ces de skad ma zer cig /'di ni dge slong la la mal stan sar pa la 'dug cing de zan zos nas gcig pu phyogs gcig na mi smra bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyim bdag mgo reg ces de skad ma zer cig /'di ni dge slong la la mal stan sar pa la 'dug cing de zan zos nas gcig pu phyogs gcig na mi smra bar 'dug ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, do not say that ‘householder-monks’ are like that. Some monks sit on a new seat, eat food, and then sit alone in one place in silence.

original: bsam gtan byed la lus kyi rang bzhin la yang lta bar byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan byed la lus kyi rang bzhin la yang lta bar byed do //
translated: They practice concentration and observe the nature of the body.

original: sems can 'ongs pa rnams la sbyin pa'i gtam dang / tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / bsod nams kyi gtam dang / bsod nams rnam par smin pa'i gtam dang / chog shes pa dang / smyung ba'i chos la seng ge'i sgra sgrogs par mi byed /
analyzed: sems can 'ongs pa rnams la sbyin pa'i gtam dang / tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / bsod nams kyi gtam dang / bsod nams rnam par smin pa'i gtam dang / chog shes pa dang / smyung ba'i chos la seng ge'i sgra sgrogs par mi byed /
translated: He does not roar the lion’s roar of the Dharma of generosity, moral discipline, merit, and the ripening of merit for the sake of sentient beings who have come to him.

original: seng ge lta bu'i 'khor yang mi 'chang /
analyzed: seng ge lta bu'i 'khor yang mi 'chang /
translated: He does not maintain a lion-like retinue.🔽He does not teach in order to defeat those who are immoral.

original: rtags can 'chal ba tshar bcad pa'i phyir yang ston par mi byed pa'i dge slong de ni skye bo thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtags can 'chal ba tshar bcad pa'i phyir yang ston par mi byed pa'i dge slong de ni skye bo thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang ma yin /
translated: Such a monk does not benefit all beings,

original: bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor does he benefit himself.

original: nyon mongs pa zhan pa yin pas tshul khrims dang ldan pa tshangs par @61b spyod pa tsam du yang zad do //🔽dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhan pa yin pas tshul khrims dang ldan pa tshangs par @61b spyod pa tsam du yang zad do // dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
translated: He is weak in afflictions, and that is all he has: moral discipline and mere pure conduct.🔽“ ‘There is another monk who is morally disciplined,

original: dge ba'i chos can gzhan zhig gnas gzhan zhig na mal sta sar pa la 'dug cing seng ge'i sgra sgrogs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos can gzhan zhig gnas gzhan zhig na mal sta sar pa la 'dug cing seng ge'i sgra sgrogs te /
translated: who is virtuous, and who sits on a new seat and roars the lion’s roar of the Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir gsung rab yan lag dgu /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir gsung rab yan lag dgu /
translated: In order to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings, he taught the nine branches of the scriptures:

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad ba'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang /🔽rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde rnams ston te /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad ba'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde rnams ston te /
translated: the sutra class, the geya class, the vyakarana class, the gathas class, the udana class, the nidana class, the itivrttaka class, the jataka class, and the vaipulya class.

original: mdo sde 'di la dge slong bran dang bran mo dang / ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa rdzas ngan pa 'chang ba rnams chad pas bcad par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la dge slong bran dang bran mo dang / ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa rdzas ngan pa 'chang ba rnams chad pas bcad par bshad pa ni /
translated: The sutras explain that monks who possess such negative things as male and female servants, cattle, and buffaloes should be punished.

original: bdag cag gi rkyen du 'tsham pa yin te /🔽mdo che be mo zhig las kyang rab tu byung ba /
analyzed: bdag cag gi rkyen du 'tsham pa yin te / mdo che be mo zhig las kyang rab tu byung ba /
translated: This is suitable for our circumstances.

original: rdzas ngan 'chang ba rnams /
analyzed: rdzas ngan 'chang ba rnams /
translated: In a certain great sutra, it says that monks who possess negative things🔽should be punished by the king.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po che ge mo zhig la chad pas gcod du bcug ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po che ge mo zhig la chad pas gcod du bcug ste /
translated: The Buddha told a certain king to punish them.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams ni gos skye bo gyon du bcug go zhes ston cing /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams ni gos skye bo gyon du bcug go zhes ston cing /
translated: I have allowed those who have violated their ethics to wear the robes of the saṅgha.

original: de de ltar seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa la /
analyzed: de de ltar seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa la /
translated: When he roars like a lion in this way,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams kyis dkrugs pa ma byas te /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams kyis dkrugs pa ma byas te /
translated: those who have violated their ethics will not be able to disturb him.

original: srog bcad du zin kyang dge slong de la ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
analyzed: srog bcad du zin kyang dge slong de la ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa /
translated: Even if he were to kill, I would say that such a monk is ethical,

original: bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa zhes nga zer ro //🔽rgyu des na rgyal po dang blon po dang / dge bsnyen rnams la dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa zhes nga zer ro // rgyu des na rgyal po dang blon po dang / dge bsnyen rnams la dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: and that he is engaged in benefiting himself and others.🔽For that reason, I have allowed the king, the ministers, and the lay followers to protect the true Dharma

original: ngas dge slong rnams bsrung bar yang gnang khyim bdag mgo reg rnams chad pas gcod du yang gnang ngo //
analyzed: ngas dge slong rnams bsrung bar yang gnang khyim bdag mgo reg rnams chad pas gcod du yang gnang ngo //
translated: and to punish those who have violated their ethics.

original: de la tshul khrims 'chal pa gang yin pa de dag ni khyim bdag mgo reg ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims 'chal pa gang yin pa de dag ni khyim bdag mgo reg ces bya ste /
translated: Those who have violated their ethics are called lay followers with shaven heads.

original: de ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i tshig bla dags ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i tshig bla dags ma yin no //
translated: This is not an expression of respect for those who are ethical.

original: rigs kyi bu sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa grangs med pa'i snga rol du grong khyer ku sh'i 'di nyid du /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na bskal pa grangs med pa'i snga rol du grong khyer ku sh'i 'di nyid du /
translated: “Son of noble family, in the past, long ago, incalculable eons ago, in this very city of Kuśinagarī,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dga' skyed ces bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dga' skyed ces bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Delightful appeared in the world.

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi khams 'di bde ba can bzhin du yangs par gyur te /🔽de'i tshe sems can dag bde ba can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi khams 'di bde ba can bzhin du yangs par gyur te / de'i tshe sems can dag bde ba can gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams bzhin du /
translated: At that time, this world system was as vast as the Blissful buddha realm.🔽At that time, beings were not weak from hunger,

original: bru bas nyam chung ba med do //🔽de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de lo bye ba phrag du ma bzhugs bzhugs nas grong khyer 'di nyid dang / gnas 'di nyid @62a * //
analyzed: bru bas nyam chung ba med do // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de lo bye ba phrag du ma bzhugs bzhugs nas grong khyer 'di nyid dang / gnas 'di nyid @62a * //
translated: like the bodhisattvas in the Blissful buddha realm.🔽Then, after that thus-gone one had lived for many millions of years, he passed into parinirvāṇa

original: du mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: du mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: right here in this city, in this very place.

original: de nas de'i bstan pa lo bye ba phrag du ma'i bar du gnas nas /
analyzed: de nas de'i bstan pa lo bye ba phrag du ma'i bar du gnas nas /
translated: His teachings remained for many millions of years,

original: gang gi tshe bstan pa gnas pa de'i lhag ma lo bzhi bcu lus pa de'i tshe dam pa'i chos nub tu cha ba'i dus na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bstan pa gnas pa de'i lhag ma lo bzhi bcu lus pa de'i tshe dam pa'i chos nub tu cha ba'i dus na /
translated: When the teachings remained for the remaining forty years, at the time when the true Dharma was about to disappear,

original: dge slong sangs rgyas phyin zhes bya ba g-yog 'khor mang po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dge slong sangs rgyas phyin zhes bya ba g-yog 'khor mang po dang ldan pa /
translated: there was a monk called Buddhajñāna, who had many attendants and followers.

original: seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa /
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa /
translated: He roared the lion’s roar,

original: gsung rab yan lag dgu'i chos ston pa zhig byung ste /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag dgu'i chos ston pa zhig byung ste /
translated: and taught the Dharma of the nine branches of scripture.🔽He was killed by those who held to the inferior Dharma of servants, male and female servants, cattle, buffalo, and so forth,

original: de bran dang bran mo dang / ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa rdzas ngan pa 'chang ba log pa'i chos ston pa /
analyzed: de bran dang bran mo dang / ba lang dang ma he la sogs pa rdzas ngan pa 'chang ba log pa'i chos ston pa /
translated: who taught false Dharma,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyis thos nas bsad pa'i sems skyed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyis thos nas bsad pa'i sems skyed de /
translated: and who, when they heard of him, gave rise to the thought of killing, with minds full of hatred and immoral discipline.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i phyogs rnams gcig tu bsdongs nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i phyogs rnams gcig tu bsdongs nas /
translated: The immoral factions gathered together,

original: mtshon cha sna tshogs lag na thogs te /
analyzed: mtshon cha sna tshogs lag na thogs te /
translated: and took up various weapons in their hands.

original: dge slong de'i thad du dong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong de'i thad du dong ngo //
translated: They went to where the monk was.

original: nga yang de'i tshe rgyal po srid sbyin zhes bya bar gyur te /
analyzed: nga yang de'i tshe rgyal po srid sbyin zhes bya bar gyur te /
translated: At that time, I was also a king called Mahadāna.🔽When that king heard that story,

original: rgyal po des gtam de thos nas /
analyzed: rgyal po des gtam de thos nas /
translated: he thought,

original: dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to protect the holy Dharma,

original: dge slong de'i thad du song ste /
analyzed: dge slong de'i thad du song ste /
translated: he went to the monk

original: de dag dang g-yul bkye'o //
analyzed: de dag dang g-yul bkye'o //
translated: and did battle with him.

original: de nas chos smra ba de de dag gis ma tshugs so //
analyzed: de nas chos smra ba de de dag gis ma tshugs so //
translated: Then the Dharma teacher was not able to prevail against them.

original: rgyal po de ni ral gri dang / mdung thung kha leb dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / mda' rnams kyis lus la ma gtsags pa'i sa mtshams yungs 'bru tsam yang med par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal po de ni ral gri dang / mdung thung kha leb dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / mda' rnams kyis lus la ma gtsags pa'i sa mtshams yungs 'bru tsam yang med par gyur to //
translated: The king was pierced by swords, short javelins, spears, vajra-tipped arrows, and so on, and there was not even a space the size of a sesame seed on his body that was not wounded.

original: de nas dge slong des rgyal po de de ltar gyur pa mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas dge slong des rgyal po de de ltar gyur pa mthong nas /
translated: Then the monk, seeing the king in that condition,

original: legs so zhes smras te /
analyzed: legs so zhes smras te /
translated: said, “Excellent!

original: dam pa'i chos bsrung bas de ni de ltar bya dgos so /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsrung bas de ni de ltar bya dgos so /
translated: In order to protect the holy Dharma, this is what must be done.

original: khyod ni chos dpag tu med pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes byas so //
analyzed: khyod ni chos dpag tu med pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes byas so //
translated: You will have the good fortune of immeasurable Dharma.”

original: de nas rgyal po des dge slong de'i tshig thos nas shi ba'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skyes so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po des dge slong de'i tshig thos nas shi ba'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su skyes so //
translated: Then the king, having heard the words of the monk, died and was reborn in the world system of the Tathāgata Akṣobhya.

original: der sems can gang rjes su yi rang bar gyur pa rnams dang / g-yul 'gyed pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang byang chub thob par gyur to //
analyzed: der sems can gang rjes su yi rang bar gyur pa rnams dang / g-yul 'gyed pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang byang chub thob par gyur to //
translated: All the sentient beings who rejoiced in that, and all those who fought in the battle, attained enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams su /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams su /
translated: In the world system called Abhirati of the Tathagata Akshobhya,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba zhig kyang byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba zhig kyang byung ngo //
translated: there was a Tathagata called Akshobhya-rupa.

original: dge slong sangs rgyas byin yang rgyal po de shi ba'i rjes la shi nas /
analyzed: dge slong sangs rgyas byin yang rgyal po de shi ba'i rjes la shi nas /
translated: The monk Buddhadatta died after the king's death,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i bstan pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i bstan pa la /
translated: and in the doctrine of the Tathagata Akshobhya,

original: nyan thos kyi mchog tu gyur to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mchog tu gyur to //
translated: he became the foremost of the shravakas.

original: @62b rgyal po de yang nyan thos gnyis par gyur to //
analyzed: @62b rgyal po de yang nyan thos gnyis par gyur to //
translated: That king became the second shravaka.

original: de ltar na dam pa'i chos nub pa'i tshe dam pa'i chos dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dam pa'i chos nub pa'i tshe dam pa'i chos dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, when the holy Dharma is disappearing, the holy Dharma should be upheld.

original: de'i tshe la por gyur pa de ni nga yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe la por gyur pa de ni nga yin no //
translated: At that time, the one who became the king was me.

original: dge slong de ni sangs rgyas 'od srungs yin te /
analyzed: dge slong de ni sangs rgyas 'od srungs yin te /
translated: That monk was Buddha Kashyapa.

original: de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: He has entered parinirvāṇa.

original: de ltar na dam pa'i chos bsrungs pa'i 'bras bu ni dpag tu med de /
analyzed: de ltar na dam pa'i chos bsrungs pa'i 'bras bu ni dpag tu med de /
translated: Thus, the result of protecting the true Dharma is immeasurable.

original: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa des na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par dag pa des na /
translated: By means of that pure result,

original: nga yang rma bya mdongs ri mo can mang pos brgyan pa lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: nga yang rma bya mdongs ri mo can mang pos brgyan pa lta bur gyur te /
translated: I have become like a peacock adorned with many colorful feathers,

original: mi shigs pa'i sku dang / chos kyi sku brnyes par gyur to //
analyzed: mi shigs pa'i sku dang / chos kyi sku brnyes par gyur to //
translated: and have attained the indestructible body and the Dharma body.

original: 'od srungs chen po dang rus gcig pas gsol pa /
analyzed: 'od srungs chen po dang rus gcig pas gsol pa /
translated: Mahākāśyapa of the same clan said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rdol la brkos pa'i yi ge bzhin du rtag pa'i sku dang ldan lags so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rdol la brkos pa'i yi ge bzhin du rtag pa'i sku dang ldan lags so //
translated: The Tathāgata possesses a permanent body, like letters carved on stone.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: rigs kyi bu de bas na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bas na /
translated: Son of noble family, therefore,

original: dam pa'i chos bsrung bar 'dod pas ni /🔽dge slong ngam /🔽dge slong ma 'am /🔽dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsrung bar 'dod pas ni / dge slong ngam / dge slong ma 'am / dge bsnyen nam /
translated: those who wish to protect the true Dharma

original: dge bsnyen ma gang na yod pa der bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma gang na yod pa der bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: should protect wherever there are bhikṣus,🔽bhikṣuṇīs,🔽upāsakas,🔽or upāsikās.

original: dge bsnyen dam pa'i chos bsrung pa'i 'bras bu ni rgya che'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dam pa'i chos bsrung pa'i 'bras bu ni rgya che'o //
translated: The result of the upāsaka’s protection of the true Dharma is vast.

original: rigs kyi bu de bas na dge slong rnams mtshon cha lag na thogs pa'i dge bsnyen dag gis mdun du bdar te rgyu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bas na dge slong rnams mtshon cha lag na thogs pa'i dge bsnyen dag gis mdun du bdar te rgyu bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, son of noble family, monks should be accompanied and escorted by lay followers who carry weapons.

original: theg pa chen po 'di la ni dge bsnyen gyi bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la ni dge bsnyen gyi bslab pa'i gzhi lnga blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: In this Great Vehicle, one should not take up the five precepts of a lay follower.

original: dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir lag na mtshon cha thogs shing /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsrung ba'i phyir lag na mtshon cha thogs shing /
translated: In order to protect the sacred Dharma, one should carry weapons in one’s hands

original: dge slong rnams bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: and protect the monks.

original: gsol pa / ci lags dge slong gang dag de lta bu'i dge bsnyen lag na mtshon cha thogs pa dang lhan cig 'grogs shing rgyu ba de dag slob dpon lags sam /
analyzed: gsol pa / ci lags dge slong gang dag de lta bu'i dge bsnyen lag na mtshon cha thogs pa dang lhan cig 'grogs shing rgyu ba de dag slob dpon lags sam /
translated: ” He asked, “Are those monks who associate and travel together with such lay followers who carry weapons in their hands teachers,

original: 'on te slob dpon ma lags /
analyzed: 'on te slob dpon ma lags /
translated: or are they not teachers?

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bgyi 'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bgyi 'am /
translated: Are they called immoral,

original: 'on te mi bgyi lags /
analyzed: 'on te mi bgyi lags /
translated: or are they not?”🔽The Blessed One replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽🔽

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu nang 'khrug 'byung ba dang / yul bcom pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu nang 'khrug 'byung ba dang / yul bcom pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Son of noble family, after the parinirvāṇa of the Tathāgata, there will be internal strife and the destruction of countries.

original: dus ngan par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dus ngan par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: In that time of degeneration,

original: mu ge'i nyes pas phal cher rab tu 'byung zhing /🔽mgo reg tu 'gyur te de dag gis dge slong tshul khrims dang / cho ga dang yon tan dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dag skrod par 'gyur /
analyzed: mu ge'i nyes pas phal cher rab tu 'byung zhing / mgo reg tu 'gyur te de dag gis dge slong tshul khrims dang / cho ga dang yon tan dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dag skrod par 'gyur /
translated: most will go forth due to the calamity of famine.

original: gsod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsod par 'gyur te /
translated: They will become shaven-headed, and they will expel and kill fully ordained monks who are endowed with discipline, ritual purity, good qualities, and perfect conduct.

original: der dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams kyis grong dang / grong khyer dang / ri khrod kyi grong dag tu ji ltar rgyu bar bya ste /🔽de lta bu dag @63a * //
analyzed: der dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams kyis grong dang / grong khyer dang / ri khrod kyi grong dag tu ji ltar rgyu bar bya ste /🔽de lta bu dag @63a * //
translated: There, how should fully ordained monks wander in villages, cities, and mountain retreats?

original: gi dus na dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa slob dpon du gyur pa rnams lam du 'gro ba dang / rang gi srog bsrung ba'i phyir mtshon cha lag na thogs pa dag dang 'gro bar ngas gnang ngo //
analyzed: gi dus na dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa slob dpon du gyur pa rnams lam du 'gro ba dang / rang gi srog bsrung ba'i phyir mtshon cha lag na thogs pa dag dang 'gro bar ngas gnang ngo //
translated: At that time, I allowed monks who were endowed with moral discipline and had become teachers to carry weapons in their hands for the sake of protecting their lives while traveling.🔽Upāsakas, householders, kings, and ministers

original: dge bsnyen rnams dang / khyim bdag dang / rgyal po dang blon po rnams kyis /
analyzed: dge bsnyen rnams dang / khyim bdag dang / rgyal po dang blon po rnams kyis /
translated: should also carry weapons

original: dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to protect monks who are endowed with moral discipline.

original: mtshon cha 'chang ba de yang tshul khrims yin zhes nga zer te /
analyzed: mtshon cha 'chang ba de yang tshul khrims yin zhes nga zer te /
translated: I say that is moral discipline.

original: 'on kyang gsad par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsad par ni mi bya'o //
translated: However, they should not kill.

original: bzlog pa'i phyir mtshon cha bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir mtshon cha bcang bar bya ste /
translated: They should carry weapons for the sake of turning back [aggression].

original: de ni mchog tu mkhas pa'i tshul khrims yin no //
analyzed: de ni mchog tu mkhas pa'i tshul khrims yin no //
translated: That is the moral discipline of the most skilled.

original: slob dpon ni theg pa chen po'i gdams ngag ston pa dang / yang dag par lta ba dang / rung ba ma yin pa'i gdugs dang / 'bru mar gyi snod dang / 'bras bu'i rnam grangs rnams spangs pa dang / rgyal po dang blon po rnams la mi brten pa dang /
analyzed: slob dpon ni theg pa chen po'i gdams ngag ston pa dang / yang dag par lta ba dang / rung ba ma yin pa'i gdugs dang / 'bru mar gyi snod dang / 'bras bu'i rnam grangs rnams spangs pa dang / rgyal po dang blon po rnams la mi brten pa dang /
translated: The master is one who teaches the instructions of the Great Vehicle, who has the correct view, who has abandoned the unsuitable parasol, oil vessel, and enumeration of fruits, who does not rely on kings and ministers,

original: rnyed pa'i phyir sbyin pa po rnams la dga' ba dang / snyan par smra ba ma yin pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang ; tshul 'chos med pa'i dge sbyong gi dngos po sel ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa'i phyir sbyin pa po rnams la dga' ba dang / snyan par smra ba ma yin pa dang / spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dang ; tshul 'chos med pa'i dge sbyong gi dngos po sel ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang /
translated: who does not delight in and speak pleasantly to donors for the sake of gain, who has perfect conduct, who does not eliminate the state of being a monk without hypocrisy, who has moral discipline,

original: dge ba'i chos can dang / rgyal po dang 'dra ba'i blo gros 'chang ba dang / byad gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti gzhan mi 'dod pa dang / chog shes shing yo byad pa snyungs pa ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos can dang / rgyal po dang 'dra ba'i blo gros 'chang ba dang / byad gzugs dang / cha byad dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti gzhan mi 'dod pa dang / chog shes shing yo byad pa snyungs pa ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: who has virtuous qualities, who bears the wisdom like a king, who does not desire other forms, attire, gain, or honor, who is content and shows few possessions.

original: de ni slob dpon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni slob dpon zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called a master.

original: de'i 'khor rnyed pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa'i rang gi 'khor gyi dge 'dun ga yin pa de dag ni zlog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'khor rnyed pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa'i rang gi 'khor gyi dge 'dun ga yin pa de dag ni zlog par byed do //
translated: He turns away from the Sangha of his own disciples who are his retinue, who desire gain and honor.

original: de la dge 'dun yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the Sangha is of three kinds:

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa dang 'dres pa dang / byis pa'i dge 'dun dang / rang bzhin gyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa dang 'dres pa dang / byis pa'i dge 'dun dang / rang bzhin gyi dge 'dun no //
translated: the Sangha of the immoral mixed together, the Sangha of the childish, and the natural Sangha.

original: de la tshul khrims 'chal pa dang 'dres pa'i dge 'dun ni des zlog par byed de /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims 'chal pa dang 'dres pa'i dge 'dun ni des zlog par byed de /
translated: Therein, the Sangha of the immoral mixed together is turned away from by him.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa nga 'dres pa'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa nga 'dres pa'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Sangha of the immoral mixed together is

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams 'ba' zhig dang mthun par byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams 'ba' zhig dang mthun par byed de /
translated: he who is in accord with only the immoral.

original: de dag tshar gtsod par mi byed cing /
analyzed: de dag tshar gtsod par mi byed cing /
translated: He does not subdue them,

original: zang zing gi phyir de dag dang lhan cig tu spyod pa mthun par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zang zing gi phyir de dag dang lhan cig tu spyod pa mthun par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: but acts in accord with them for the sake of material things.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan du zin kyang de dag dang lhan cig gnas pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan du zin kyang de dag dang lhan cig gnas pas /
translated: Even though he is endowed with morality,🔽he is in accord with them because he lives with them.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa kho na yin pa'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa kho na yin pa'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is counted as a person who has broken the precepts.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal pa dang 'dres pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims 'chal pa dang 'dres pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “mixed with those who have broken the precepts.”

original: de'i tshul med pa zlog @63b par byed pa'i phyir slob dpon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshul med pa zlog @63b par byed pa'i phyir slob dpon zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he turns away from that which is not the precepts, he is called a teacher.

original: byis pa'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa dang / bsod snyoms pa zhan pa dang / rmugs pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: byis pa'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa dang / bsod snyoms pa zhan pa dang / rmugs pa rnams yin te /
translated: The “foolish saṅgha” is those who live in the wilderness, who are poor, and who are dull-witted.

original: dgag dbye dang / gso sbyong rnams kyi dus su /
analyzed: dgag dbye dang / gso sbyong rnams kyi dus su /
translated: At the time of the poṣadha and the pravāraṇa,

original: rang gi 'khor nyi tshe dag par byed kyi /
analyzed: rang gi 'khor nyi tshe dag par byed kyi /
translated: they purify only their own retinue.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams dag par mi byed par /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams dag par mi byed par /
translated: They do not purify those who have broken the precepts.

original: de dag dang lhan cig tu 'dre bar gnas pa de ni byis pa'i dge 'dun zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig tu 'dre bar gnas pa de ni byis pa'i dge 'dun zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who live in association with them are called the foolish saṅgha.

original: rmugs pa de dag ni tshul ma yin pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir slob dpon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa de dag ni tshul ma yin pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir slob dpon zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they turn away from that which is not the precepts, they are called teachers.

original: rang bzhin gyi dge 'dun ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dge 'dun ni /
translated: The “natural saṅgha”

original: bdud bye ba snyed kyis kyang mi shigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdud bye ba snyed kyis kyang mi shigs pa yin te /
translated: cannot be destroyed even by millions of Māras.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This is the natural purity of the bodhisattva saṅgha.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dge 'dun rnam pa gnyis zlog par byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dge 'dun rnam pa gnyis zlog par byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who turn away from the two kinds of saṅgha of those with faulty ethics🔽are called masters.

original: slob dpon zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / yang mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: slob dpon zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / yang mdo de nyid las /
translated: And in that very sūtra it is said:

original: de bzhin du deng ngas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gsang chen ma lus par bstan kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du deng ngas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gsang chen ma lus par bstan kyang /
translated: In the same way, today I have taught the great parinirvāṇa, the great secret, without remainder.

original: sems can snod du ma gyur pa gang yin pa de dag gis mi thos so //
analyzed: sems can snod du ma gyur pa gang yin pa de dag gis mi thos so //
translated: But those sentient beings who are not suitable vessels do not hear it.

original: yang bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yang bka' stsal pa /
translated: And it is also said:

original: gang dag la ni yongs bsags med //
analyzed: gang dag la ni yongs bsags med //
translated: Those who do not accumulate

original: gang dag gis ni zas mi rtogs //
analyzed: gang dag gis ni zas mi rtogs //
translated: and those who do not conceive of food,

original: mkha' la bya rnams rjes 'dra bar //
analyzed: mkha' la bya rnams rjes 'dra bar //
translated: like the tracks of birds in the sky,

original: de dag rjes bcad dka' ba yin //
analyzed: de dag rjes bcad dka' ba yin //
translated: their tracks are difficult to discern.

original: bstan pa 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di'i don ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this teaching?

original: su dag la ni yongs bsags med //
analyzed: su dag la ni yongs bsags med //
translated: Those who do not accumulate

original: su dag gis ni zas mi rtogs //
analyzed: su dag gis ni zas mi rtogs //
translated: and those who do not conceive of food,

original: gang dag gis ni rjes bcad dka' //
analyzed: gang dag gis ni rjes bcad dka' //
translated: those whose tracks are difficult to discern,

original: su song gang du song ba na //
analyzed: su song gang du song ba na //
translated: wherever they go,

original: de dag rjes bcad dka' ba yin //
analyzed: de dag rjes bcad dka' ba yin //
translated: It is difficult to distinguish them afterwards.

original: de la rin po che la sogs pa bsags pa'o //
analyzed: de la rin po che la sogs pa bsags pa'o //
translated: Therein, the accumulation of jewels, etc.

original: yongs zhes bya ba ni phrad de bye brag gi tshig go //
analyzed: yongs zhes bya ba ni phrad de bye brag gi tshig go //
translated: The word “entire” means “having met,” and is a word of distinction.

original: yongs zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don te /
analyzed: yongs zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don te /
translated: The word “entire” means the meaning of “collected.”

original: 'dir rdzas bzang po sgrub pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir rdzas bzang po sgrub pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, it means “having accomplished good substances.”

original: bsags pa zhes bya ba dang / nor zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: bsags pa zhes bya ba dang / nor zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: The words “accumulation” and “wealth” have the same meaning.

original: gang dag nor yongs su bsags par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang dag nor yongs su bsags par byed pa de ni /
translated: Those who make an accumulation of wealth,

original: de dag gi yongs su bsags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yongs su bsags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called their “accumulation.”

original: de la yongs su bsags pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yongs su bsags pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, that which is called “accumulation” is of two kinds:

original: 'dus byas yongs su bsags pa dang / 'dus ma byas yongs su bsags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas yongs su bsags pa dang / 'dus ma byas yongs su bsags pa'o //
translated: the accumulation of the conditioned and the accumulation of the unconditioned.

original: de la nyan thos ni 'dus byas yongs su bsags pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyan thos ni 'dus byas yongs su bsags pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Therein, the śrāvaka is the aspect of the accumulation of the conditioned.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dus ma byas yongs su bsags pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dus ma byas yongs su bsags pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is the aspect of the accumulation of the unconditioned.

original: dge 'dun ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge 'dun ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Saṅgha is of two kinds:
the conditioned Saṅgha and the unconditioned Saṅgha.

original: byas kyi dge 'dun dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: byas kyi dge 'dun dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The Sangha of the conditioned and the Sangha of the unconditioned.

original: de la 'dus byas kyi dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Sangha of the conditioned is

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun yin no //
translated: the Sangha of the disciples.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la ni yongs su bsags pa yang med na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la ni yongs su bsags pa yang med na /
translated: The Sangha of the disciples has no possessions,

original: bran dang bran mo rnams la sogs pa rdzas ngan pa rnams dang / mdzod dang bang ba yongs su 'dzin pa lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: bran dang bran mo rnams la sogs pa rdzas ngan pa rnams dang / mdzod dang bang ba yongs su 'dzin pa lta ga la yod de /
translated: so how could they have bad possessions such as male and female servants, or storehouses and treasuries?

original: 'ongs pa yin pas na de dag ni lan tshva dang / til tsam yang yongs su bsags par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'ongs pa yin pas na de dag ni lan tshva dang / til tsam yang yongs su bsags par mi byed do //
translated: They do not even accumulate salt and oil.

original: gang dag bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: gang dag bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“It is possible that the tongues of those who say that the Blessed One has allowed the keeping of male and female servants, etc.

original: bdag cag la bran dang bran mo la sogs pa 'chang du gnang ngo zhes zer ba de dag gi lce ni lkugs par 'gyur srid do //
analyzed: bdag cag la bran dang bran mo la sogs pa 'chang du gnang ngo zhes zer ba de dag gi lce ni lkugs par 'gyur srid do //
translated: will become stuck to their food.

original: nyan thos de dag ni yongs su bsags pa med pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos de dag ni yongs su bsags pa med pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: Those disciples have the aspect of having no possessions.

original: de dag ni zas yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zas yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: They know about food.

original: gang zag zas la zhen pa med pa de dag ni zas yongs su shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag zas la zhen pa med pa de dag ni zas yongs su shes pa yin te /
translated: Those who are not attached to food are those who understand food.

original: de dag ni 'gro ba'i lam du rjes bcad par dka'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gro ba'i lam du rjes bcad par dka'o //
translated: They are difficult to follow on the path of beings.

original: de dag ni myur ba kho nar sangs rgyas nyid du nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: de dag ni myur ba kho nar sangs rgyas nyid du nye bar gnas so //
translated: They are quickly established in buddhahood.

original: de dag gi 'gro ba ni rjes bcad dka'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi 'gro ba ni rjes bcad dka'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gsung ngo //
translated: The Tathāgata says that their going is difficult to follow.

original: yang bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yang bka' stsal pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: gal te 'dus byas kyi dge 'dun la yang bsags pa med na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas kyi dge 'dun la yang bsags pa med na /
translated: If there is no accumulation even in the conditioned saṅgha,

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i dge 'dun la lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i dge 'dun la lta ga la yod de /
translated: how could there be in the unconditioned saṅgha?

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i dge 'dun ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i dge 'dun ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The unconditioned saṅgha is the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gsang ba'i chos bstan pa ga la yod /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gsang ba'i chos bstan pa ga la yod /
translated: How could the Tathāgata teach the secret Dharma?

original: gsang ba gang yin pa de yongs su bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba gang yin pa de yongs su bsags pa'o //
translated: What is secret is accumulated.

original: rjes bcad du med pa ni mi g-yo ba'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: rjes bcad du med pa ni mi g-yo ba'i bde ba ste /
translated: What is difficult to follow is immovable bliss.🔽It teaches the meaning of nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i don ston to zhes gsungs pa dang / yang mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i don ston to zhes gsungs pa dang / yang mdo de nyid las /
translated: And in that very sūtra:

original: rigs kyi bu dge 'dun gang dag gzhi chen po brgyad shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa der /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dge 'dun gang dag gzhi chen po brgyad shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa der /
translated: Son of noble family, those saṅgha members who, knowing the eight great bases, engage in them,

original: gal te tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i dge slong dag 'khod na /🔽de dag ni ji ltar ka ra ka'i tshal na /
analyzed: gal te tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i dge slong dag 'khod na / de dag ni ji ltar ka ra ka'i tshal na /
translated: if there are monks who are endowed with ethical discipline,🔽they are like the tinduka tree🔽in a kāra grove.

original: tin tu ka'i shing 'dug pa de bzhin du de dag ma mthong na /
analyzed: tin tu ka'i shing 'dug pa de bzhin du de dag ma mthong na /
translated: If they are not seen,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: even if they are endowed with ethical discipline,

original: dge bsnyen shes rab can gyis de la phyag mi bya zhing /
analyzed: dge bsnyen shes rab can gyis de la phyag mi bya zhing /
translated: the wise layperson should not prostrate to them

original: mchod pa'i gnas su mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i gnas su mi bya'o //
translated: and should not make them the object of worship.

original: gal te de dag la phyag bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te de dag la phyag bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to prostrate to them,

original: ci khyed gzhi chen po brgyad len par byed dam /
analyzed: ci khyed gzhi chen po brgyad len par byed dam /
translated: one should ask, “Do you accept the eight great bases?

original: 'on te len par mi byed ces dris nas /
analyzed: 'on te len par mi byed ces dris nas /
translated: Or do you not accept them?”🔽and only then should one prostrate.”

original: gdod phyag bya ste zhes gsungs pa dang / yang mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: gdod phyag bya ste zhes gsungs pa dang / yang mdo de nyid las /
translated: And the same sūtra says:

original: yi ge ma yin no zhes bya ba ni chog @64b mi shes pa dang / yo byad ma bsnyungs pa dang / 'dod chen dang / tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag byed par 'gyur ba'i rang bzo'i yi ge dang / tshig sna tshogs sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin pa'i mdo sde rnams yin te /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag cag la thugs brtse bas mu ge byung ba'i tshe /🔽nyid kyi sras rnams nyon mongs par mi 'gyur bar mdzad pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'dod pas logs par g-yem pa'i rnam par smin pas ni ldan ljin dang rdul dang tshub ma dang ma rung ba'i rlung dang char 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: brdzun du smra ba'i rnam par smin pas ni kha dring ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i rnam par smin pas ni kha dring ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: The maturation of lying is false accusations.🔽The maturation of divisive speech is the appearance of bad friends.🔽The maturation of harsh speech is unpleasant sounds.

original: / phra ma'i rnam par smin pas ni rtsva tshang tshing dang nags thibs po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / phra ma'i rnam par smin pas ni rtsva tshang tshing dang nags thibs po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The maturation of idle chatter is untimely wind, rain, and harvests.🔽The maturation of covetousness is the appearance of bad harvests.🔽The maturation of ill will is the appearance of bad harvests.🔽The maturation of wrong views is the appearance of bad harvests.

analyzed: tshig rtsub po'i rnam par smin pas ni gseg ma dang gyo mo dang reg na mi bde zhing rtsub pa'i dngos po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: brnab sems kyi rnam par smin pas ni lo tog rnams 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brnab sems kyi rnam par smin pas ni lo tog rnams 'bras bu chung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gnod sems kyi rnam par smin pas ni lo tog 'bras bu med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pas ni lo tog rnams 'bras bu kha ba dang tsha ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper na /

analyzed: gdol pa ni rtag tu dur khrod spyod yul ba yin te /

analyzed: shi ba la re ba dang / byams pa med pa'i mig gis 'gro ba la blta ba dang / shi ba la dga' ba yin no //

analyzed: de nas rnyed pa dang bkur stis nye bar 'tsho zhing /

analyzed: khyim pa de dag chos sam 'dul ba yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug pa dang / de rnyed pa'i ched du 'dris par byed kyi /

analyzed: 'od srungs 'di ni dge sbyong gdol pa lta bu zhes bya'o //

analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za rnams kyang /
translated: gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas

original: 'di dag ni bstan pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes gus pa cher skyed do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bstan pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes gus pa cher skyed do //
translated: will generate great respect, thinking, “These are the ones who uphold the teachings.”

original: 'od srungs chom rkun pa lta bu'i dge sbyong bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'od srungs chom rkun pa lta bu'i dge sbyong bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung ba ni /
