original: skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems gcig kyang mi bskyed na /
analyzed: skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems gcig kyang mi bskyed na /
translated: They do not generate even a single thought of disenchantment or detachment,

original: 'bras bu thob pa lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa lta ci smos kyi /
translated: let alone attain the fruits.

original: de ni gnas med de /
analyzed: de ni gnas med de /
translated: That is impossible.

original: 'od srungs 'di ni chom rkun lta bu'i dge slong zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di ni chom rkun lta bu'i dge slong zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so /
translated: Kāśyapa, these are called monks who are like thieves.”

original: // /'tsho ba yongs su dag pa la dgongs pa bstan pa /
analyzed: // /'tsho ba yongs su dag pa la dgongs pa bstan pa /
translated: The teaching on the intention of pure livelihood

original: byams pa seng ge'i sgra'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: byams pa seng ge'i sgra'i mdo las kyang /
translated: In the Maitreya’s Lion’s Roar Sutra it says,

original: 'od srungs de dag dbugs 'byin pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs de dag dbugs 'byin pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, I will describe the ones who are sighing.

original: de thos nas rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: de thos nas rnal 'byor pa /
translated: When they hear this, the yogis

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa dag dga' ba dang mgu bar 'gyur ro //🔽'od srungs rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa dag dga' ba dang mgu bar 'gyur ro // 'od srungs rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: and yoginīs will be delighted and overjoyed.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis /
translated: Kāśyapa, if a son or daughter of good family

original: gling chen po bzhi po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: gling chen po bzhi po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: Suppose that all the sentient beings in the four-continent world

original: sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad la bskal pa 'am bskal pa las lhag par bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bkur stir byas /🔽bla mar byas /🔽ri mor byas /🔽mchod par byas pa bas ni /
analyzed: sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad la bskal pa 'am bskal pa las lhag par bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bkur stir byas / bla mar byas / ri mor byas / mchod par byas pa bas ni /
translated: were to honor with all the necessities of happiness for an eon or more than an eon

original: yang dag par zhugs pa /
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa /
translated: a certain person who had entered into the right path,

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa /
translated: whose ethics were pure,

original: 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa zhig gis /🔽sbyin pa po gang gi dad pas byin pa /
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa zhig gis / sbyin pa po gang gi dad pas byin pa /
translated: and whose livelihood was pure.🔽Suppose that a certain person were to appropriate for himself

original: tha na chu snod gang tsam zhig bdag gir byas par gyur na /
analyzed: tha na chu snod gang tsam zhig bdag gir byas par gyur na /
translated: even just a water vessel given with faith by a donor.

original: de nyid de las bsod nams kyi phung po ches rgya cher 'gyur kyi /
analyzed: de nyid de las bsod nams kyi phung po ches rgya cher 'gyur kyi /
translated: The latter would have a much greater mass of merit than the former.🔽Suppose that all the sentient beings in the four-continent world

original: gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad la bskal pa 'am bskal pa las lhag par bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bkur stir byas /🔽bla mar byas /
analyzed: gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad la bskal pa 'am bskal pa las lhag par bde ba'i yo byad thams cad kyis bkur stir byas / bla mar byas /
translated: were to honor with all the necessities of happiness for an eon or more than an eon

original: ri mor byas /
analyzed: ri mor byas /
translated: a certain person who had entered into the right path,🔽whose ethics were pure,🔽and whose livelihood was pure.

original: mchod par byas pa de la ni de lta ma yin no zhes gsungs so //🔽dkon @68a * //
analyzed: mchod par byas pa de la ni de lta ma yin no zhes gsungs so // dkon @68a * //
translated: But this is not so for one who makes offerings.

original: mchog sprin gyi mdo las kyang /🔽rigs kyi bu chos bcu dang ldan na /
analyzed: mchog sprin gyi mdo las kyang / rigs kyi bu chos bcu dang ldan na /
translated: The Cloud of Jewels Sūtra also says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa rnams yin no //
translated: “Child of a good family, bodhisattvas who have ten qualities have pure livelihood.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag gi rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /🔽brda'i rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag gi rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin / brda'i rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /
translated: they are free from gain through hypocrisy and flattery;🔽they are free from gain through hints;

original: gzhogs slong gi rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /
analyzed: gzhogs slong gi rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /
translated: they are free from gain through innuendo;

original: mi rigs par btsal ba'i rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /🔽chos ma yin pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /
analyzed: mi rigs par btsal ba'i rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin / chos ma yin pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /
translated: they are free from gain through improper search;🔽they are free from gain that is contrary to the Dharma;

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin /🔽rnyed pa la zhen pa med pa rnams yin /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin / rnyed pa la zhen pa med pa rnams yin /
translated: they are free from gain that is impure;🔽they are free from attachment to gain;

original: rnyed pa lam chags pa rnams yin /
analyzed: rnyed pa lam chags pa rnams yin /
translated: they are free from craving for gain;

original: yongs su mi chad pa'i rang bzhin med pa rnams yin /
analyzed: yongs su mi chad pa'i rang bzhin med pa rnams yin /
translated: they are free from the nature of being insatiable;

original: chos nyid rnyed pas chog shes pa rnams yin no //🔽rigs kyi bu de la ji ltar na /
analyzed: chos nyid rnyed pas chog shes pa rnams yin no // rigs kyi bu de la ji ltar na /
translated: They are satisfied with the attainment of the nature of reality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag gi rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag gi rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: Son of noble family, you may wonder how bodhisattvas are free from gain that is hypocritical or deceitful.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa'i rgyu rnyed pa'i phyir lus kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa'i rgyu rnyed pa'i phyir lus kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed /
translated: Son of noble family, bodhisattvas do not deceive with their bodies, speech, or minds in order to obtain gain.🔽They do not deceive with their bodies,

original: ngag gis tshul 'chos pa mi byed /
analyzed: ngag gis tshul 'chos pa mi byed /
translated: they do not deceive with their speech,

original: sems kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed do //
analyzed: sems kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed do //
translated: and they do not deceive with their minds.

original: ji ltar na lus kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they do not deceive with their bodies?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byed pa dang / sbyin pa'i bdag po mthong na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byed pa dang / sbyin pa'i bdag po mthong na /
translated: When bodhisattvas see a donor or a benefactor,

original: spyod lam mi 'chos so //
analyzed: spyod lam mi 'chos so //
translated: they do not put on airs.

original: ji ltar spyod lam mi 'chos she na /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod lam mi 'chos she na /
translated: How is it that they do not put on airs?🔽They do not look ahead more than a yoke’s length,

original: gnya' shing gang tsam du blta ba dang / skyo bar blta ba dang / sgrib pa med par blta bas /🔽gom pa bags kyis dal ba dal bas 'dor zhing /
analyzed: gnya' shing gang tsam du blta ba dang / skyo bar blta ba dang / sgrib pa med par blta bas / gom pa bags kyis dal ba dal bas 'dor zhing /
translated: they do not look with weariness, and they do not look with obstruction.🔽They do not put down their feet slowly and deliberately,

original: 'degs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'degs pa ma yin te /
translated: nor do they lift them up slowly.

original: de ltar na lus kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na lus kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed do //
translated: Thus, he does not deceive with the body.

original: ji ltar na ngag gis tshul 'chos pa mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ngag gis tshul 'chos pa mi byed ce na /
translated: How does he not deceive with speech?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnyed pa'i rgyu rnyed pa'i phyir gcom bskyungs shing smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnyed pa'i rgyu rnyed pa'i phyir gcom bskyungs shing smra ba ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva does not speak with a hidden agenda in order to get something.

original: 'jam por smra ba ma yin /🔽dga' bar smra ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'jam por smra ba ma yin / dga' bar smra ba ma yin /
translated: He does not speak gently.🔽He does not speak pleasantly.

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i tshig brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'i tshig brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: He does not speak in a way that is agreeable to others.

original: de ltar na ngag gis tshul 'chos pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na ngag gis tshul 'chos pa mi byed do //
translated: Thus, he does not deceive with speech.

original: ji ltar na sems kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed ce na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa byed pa 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyis tshul 'chos pa mi byed ce na / byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa byed pa 'am /
translated: How does he not deceive with the mind?🔽When a bodhisattva is giving a gift

original: sbyin pa'i bdag pos rnyed pa bstabs na /🔽tshig gis 'dod pa chung bar ston cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bdag pos rnyed pa bstabs na / tshig gis 'dod pa chung bar ston cing /
translated: or when a donor or a master of the house is offering a gift,🔽he does not show with his words that he has few desires

original: sems kyis 'dod pa skyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyis 'dod pa skyed pa ma yin no //
translated: but generates desire in his mind.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Noble sir,

original: tshig gis 'dod pa chung la /
analyzed: tshig gis 'dod pa chung la /
translated: with words he shows that he has few desires,

original: sems kyis @68b rnyed pa 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: sems kyis @68b rnyed pa 'dod pa ni /
translated: but in his mind he desires gain.

original: nang gi gdung ba yin te /
analyzed: nang gi gdung ba yin te /
translated: This is an inner burning.

original: de ltar na sems kyis tshul 'chos par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na sems kyis tshul 'chos par mi byed do //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva does not pretend.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag gi rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag gi rnyed pa dang bral ba rnams yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is free of gain that is hypocritical or ingratiating.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' brda'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byed pa 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' brda'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byed pa 'am /
translated: How is it that the bodhisattva is free of gain that is indirect?🔽When the bodhisattva sees a donor

original: sbyin bdag mthong na /🔽bdag chos gos kyis phongs so //🔽bdag lhung bzed kyis phongs so //
analyzed: sbyin bdag mthong na / bdag chos gos kyis phongs so // bdag lhung bzed kyis phongs so //
translated: or a master,🔽he does not hint, saying, “I am in need of robes.🔽I am in need of a bowl.

original: bdag nad kyi rkyen rtsis phongs so zhes brda mi byed cing /🔽sbyin pa byed pa 'am /
analyzed: bdag nad kyi rkyen rtsis phongs so zhes brda mi byed cing / sbyin pa byed pa 'am /
translated: I am in need of medicine for the sick.”

original: sbyin bdag la mi slong zhing tshig tu mi brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag la mi slong zhing tshig tu mi brjod do //
translated: He does not ask the donor or the master for anything, nor does he speak of it.

original: de lta na byang chub sems dpa' brda'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na byang chub sems dpa' brda'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is free of gain that is indirect.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' gzhogs slong gi rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' gzhogs slong gi rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the bodhisattva is free of gain that is hinting?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa byed pa dang / sbyin bdag mthong na /🔽bdag la sbyin pa'i bdag po che ge mo zhig gis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sbyin pa byed pa dang / sbyin bdag mthong na / bdag la sbyin pa'i bdag po che ge mo zhig gis /
translated: he or she does not say,

original: dngos po che ge mo zhig byin te /
analyzed: dngos po che ge mo zhig byin te /
translated: “So-and-so, a great benefactor, gave me such-and-such a thing.

original: de la bdag gis kyang phan pa che ge mo zhig byas so //
analyzed: de la bdag gis kyang phan pa che ge mo zhig byas so //
translated: I did such-and-such a favor for him or her.

original: des kyang bdag la 'di ni tshul khrims dang ldan par rig ste mang du thos pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang bdag la 'di ni tshul khrims dang ldan par rig ste mang du thos pa'o //
translated: He or she knew that I am moral and learned,

original: 'dod pa chung ba'o zhes 'di dang 'di byin no //🔽bdag gis kyang de la snying rje ba'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba'o zhes 'di dang 'di byin no // bdag gis kyang de la snying rje ba'i sems nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: and that I have few desires.🔽For that reason, he or she gave me this or that.”

original: blangs so zhes de skad kyi tshig mi brjod do //🔽de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzhogs slong gi rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: blangs so zhes de skad kyi tshig mi brjod do // de ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzhogs slong gi rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Nor does he or she say, “I took it out of compassion for him or her.”🔽In this way, a bodhisattva is free of the fault of hinting for gain.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' mi rigs par btsal ba'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' mi rigs par btsal ba'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that a bodhisattva is free of the fault of pursuing gain in an improper manner?

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' ni lus la rma byung ba dang / sems la rma byung bas rnyed pa tshol ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' ni lus la rma byung ba dang / sems la rma byung bas rnyed pa tshol ba ma yin te /
translated: Noble sir, bodhisattvas do not seek wealth for the sake of their own bodies or minds.

original: de la lus kyi rma ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi rma ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not seek wealth for the sake of their own bodies.

original: rnyed pa'i rgyu rnyed pa'i phyir rgyug pa dang / kun du rgyug pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i rgyu rnyed pa'i phyir rgyug pa dang / kun du rgyug pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: They do not run here and there, do not engage in misconduct, and do not seek wealth for the sake of their own bodies.

original: de la sems kyi rma ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sems kyi rma ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not seek wealth for the sake of their own minds.

original: rnyed pa la smon pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gzhan gyi rnyed pa la gnod sems mang ba ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa la smon pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gzhan gyi rnyed pa la gnod sems mang ba ste /
translated: They do not wish for wealth, and they do not have a lot of ill will toward the wealth of their companions in the celibate life.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' mi rigs par btsal ba'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' mi rigs par btsal ba'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas are free of inappropriate wealth.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos ma yin pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos ma yin pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: How are bodhisattvas free of illegitimate wealth?

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' srang la sgyu byed pa dang / gzhal ba la sgyu byed pa dang / yid brtan pa la gnod par byed pa dang / g-yos rnyed pa mi sku ba ste /🔽de ltar @69a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' srang la sgyu byed pa dang / gzhal ba la sgyu byed pa dang / yid brtan pa la gnod par byed pa dang / g-yos rnyed pa mi sku ba ste / de ltar @69a * //
translated: “Noble son, bodhisattvas do not engage in cheating with weights and measures, nor do they deceive those who trust them.🔽They do not accept gifts that are obtained through deceit.

original: na byang chub sems dpa' chos ma yin pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: na byang chub sems dpa' chos ma yin pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas are free from unrighteous gain.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' yongs su ma dag pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' yongs su ma dag pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: “How, you may wonder, are bodhisattvas free from impure gain?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gang mchod rten gyi dang 'dres pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gang mchod rten gyi dang 'dres pa 'am /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not accept or appropriate that which is mixed with the property of a stūpa,

original: chos kyi dang 'dres pa 'am /
analyzed: chos kyi dang 'dres pa 'am /
translated: that which is mixed with the property of the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun gyi dang 'dres pa 'am /🔽ma byin pa 'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dang 'dres pa 'am / ma byin pa 'am /
translated: that which is mixed with the property of the saṅgha,🔽that which is not given,

original: ma gnang ba de dag mi len cing bdag gir mi byed //
analyzed: ma gnang ba de dag mi len cing bdag gir mi byed //
translated: or that which is not permitted.

original: chags pa'i sems mi skyed de /
analyzed: chags pa'i sems mi skyed de /
translated: They do not give rise to a greedy mind.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ma dag pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' ma dag pa'i rnyed pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas are free from impure gain.🔽“

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa la zhen pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa la zhen pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that bodhisattvas are not attached to gain?

original: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa rnyed kyang /🔽bdag gir mi byed /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa rnyed kyang / bdag gir mi byed /
translated: Noble sir, here bodhisattvas, even when they get gain,🔽do not make it their own.

original: nor mi brtsi /
analyzed: nor mi brtsi /
translated: They do not hoard it.

original: tshogs su mi byed cing /
analyzed: tshogs su mi byed cing /
translated: They do not build it up.

original: dus dus su dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / pha ma dang / mdza' bo dang / blon po dang / gnyen bshes dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dag la gtong zhing /
analyzed: dus dus su dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / pha ma dang / mdza' bo dang / blon po dang / gnyen bshes dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams dag la gtong zhing /
translated: From time to time, they give it to ascetics, brahmins, their parents, friends, advisors, close relatives, and family members.

original: dus dus su bdag kyang yongs su spyod la /
analyzed: dus dus su bdag kyang yongs su spyod la /
translated: From time to time, they use it themselves.

original: yongs su spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: And when they use it,

original: chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med par yongs su spyod do //
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med par yongs su spyod do //
translated: they use it without attachment and without clinging.

original: rnyed pa ma rnyed na yang /
analyzed: rnyed pa ma rnyed na yang /
translated: Even when they do not get gain,🔽they do not get discouraged.

original: skyo ba'i sems kyang mi skyed cing /🔽yongs su yi mi 'chad de /
analyzed: skyo ba'i sems kyang mi skyed cing / yongs su yi mi 'chad de /
translated: They do not get depressed.

original: sbyin pa byed pa dang / sbyin bdag rnams la ma dad par mi 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa byed pa dang / sbyin bdag rnams la ma dad par mi 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: They do not lose faith in donors and patrons.

original: de chos dang mthun par rnyed pa ;
analyzed: de chos dang mthun par rnyed pa ;
translated: They get gain in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun gyi ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ma gtogs pa /
translated: Except for the Saṅgha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa /
translated: It is praised by the Tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpas ma smad pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ma smad pa /
translated: It is not despised by the Bodhisattvas.

original: lhas bstod pa tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pas mi 'phya bas chog shes pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: lhas bstod pa tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pas mi 'phya bas chog shes pa rnams yin no //
translated: It is praised by the gods. It is not censured by fellow practitioners. It is contentment.

original: rigs kyi bu chos bcu po 'di dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa rnams yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos bcu po 'di dag dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa rnams yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Son of noble family, if Bodhisattvas have these ten qualities, their livelihood is pure.”

original: tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: tshangs pas zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra of the Questions of Brahmaviśeṣacintin says,

original: longs spyod rung ba dag la 'dod pa chung ba'i phyir tshig tu smra ba des na seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: longs spyod rung ba dag la 'dod pa chung ba'i phyir tshig tu smra ba des na seng ge'i sgra zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Because they have few desires for suitable enjoyments, they are said to have the lion’s roar.”

original: blo gros mi zad pa la bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pa la bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra Teaching the Inexhaustible Intellect says,

original: de la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is right livelihood?

original: gang 'phags pa'i rigs dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan mi 'dor ba nyid dang / tshul 'chos pa ma yin pa nyid dang / kha gsag ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhogs slong ma yin pa nyid dang / dgang sla ba nyid dang / gso sla ba nyid dang /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i rigs dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan mi 'dor ba nyid dang / tshul 'chos pa ma yin pa nyid dang / kha gsag ma yin pa nyid dang / gzhogs slong ma yin pa nyid dang / dgang sla ba nyid dang / gso sla ba nyid dang /
translated: It is the family of the noble ones, not forsaking the qualities of training, not being hypocritical, not being deceitful, not being pretentious, being easy to nourish, being easy to please,

original: cho ga dang tshul khrims mdzes pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi rnyed @69b pa la phrag mi dog pa nyid dang / rang gi rnyed pas chog shes pa nyid dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / 'phags pas rjes su gnang ba'i 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: cho ga dang tshul khrims mdzes pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi rnyed @69b pa la phrag mi dog pa nyid dang / rang gi rnyed pas chog shes pa nyid dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid dang / 'phags pas rjes su gnang ba'i 'tsho ba ste /
translated: being beautiful in conduct and discipline, not being jealous of others’ gains, being content with one’s own gains, being irreproachable, and having a livelihood that is approved by the noble ones.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called right livelihood.”

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa las kyang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa las kyang /
translated: The Bodhisattva Levels says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni /
translated: “The bodhisattva who abides in the ethics of restraint

original: dge ba mi spyoms pa yin /
analyzed: dge ba mi spyoms pa yin /
translated: does not boast about his or her virtues.

original: sdig pa mthol ba yin /
analyzed: sdig pa mthol ba yin /
translated: He or she confesses his or her misdeeds.

original: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sdug bsngal bzod pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa'i rang bzhin can dang / ma khengs pa dang / mi brtan pa ma yin pa dang / spyod lam rab tu zhi ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sdug bsngal bzod pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa'i rang bzhin can dang / ma khengs pa dang / mi brtan pa ma yin pa dang / spyod lam rab tu zhi ba dang /
translated: They have few desires, are content, patient in the face of suffering, have a nature that is free of distress, are not arrogant, are not unstable, are calm in their behavior,

original: tshul khrims 'chos pa la sogs pa log pa'i 'tsho ba thams cad byed pa'i chos spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chos pa la sogs pa log pa'i 'tsho ba thams cad byed pa'i chos spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs so /
translated: and they have abandoned all Dharma practices that are wrong for a living, such as hypocrisy in ethical discipline.

original: // / gang gis bstan pa nub par 'gyur ba rnyed pa dang bkur sti la dgongs pa bstan pa /
analyzed: // / gang gis bstan pa nub par 'gyur ba rnyed pa dang bkur sti la dgongs pa bstan pa /
translated: The teaching on how the teaching will disappear due to concern for gain and honor

original: sangs rgyas kyi sde snod kyi mdo las kyang /🔽sh'a ri'i bu de lta mod kyi bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'i gsung rab de ni lhag par rnyed pa dang bkur sti byed pas nub par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sde snod kyi mdo las kyang /🔽sh'a ri'i bu de lta mod kyi bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'i gsung rab de ni lhag par rnyed pa dang bkur sti byed pas nub par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan te /
translated: The sutra section of the Buddha's canon states:

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar chos 'dul ba 'di ni rnyed pa dang bkur stis myur du nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar chos 'dul ba 'di ni rnyed pa dang bkur stis myur du nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Śāriputra, it is because this Dharma and Vinaya will quickly disappear due to gain and honor.

original: sh'a ri'i bu dper na mi dbul po zhig gis gter chen po rnyed nas gzhi de las bde ba dang yid bde ba nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu dper na mi dbul po zhig gis gter chen po rnyed nas gzhi de las bde ba dang yid bde ba nyams su myong ngo //
translated: Śāriputra, it is like a poor person who finds a great treasure and experiences happiness and joy on that basis.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: Śāriputra, in the same way, in the future

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar khyim pa la brten pa dang / phu dud byed pa dang / bkur sti byed pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar khyim pa la brten pa dang / phu dud byed pa dang / bkur sti byed pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: there will be monks who depend on householders, who are respected and honored.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de la khyim pa gang dag gis dge slong gang dag kyang 'jig rten gyi zang zing gis zang zing la mgron du 'bod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de la khyim pa gang dag gis dge slong gang dag kyang 'jig rten gyi zang zing gis zang zing la mgron du 'bod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Śāriputra, there will be householders who invite those monks to worldly feasts,

original: mi dbul po gter la chags pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mi dbul po gter la chags pa bzhin du /
translated: just as the poor person is attached to the treasure.

original: dge ba ma mthong ba de dag 'jig rten gyi zang zing gis yid bde bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba ma mthong ba de dag 'jig rten gyi zang zing gis yid bde bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Those who do not see virtue will be made happy by worldly feasts.

original: de dag gi las kyi mtha' rim bzhin du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi las kyi mtha' rim bzhin du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will gradually do their work.

original: de ltar na dge slong de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi zang zing lhur len par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi zang zing lhur len par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, those monks will be intent on the material things of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing gis 'khol bas chog mi shes pa dang / nye ngu la 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing gis 'khol bas chog mi shes pa dang / nye ngu la 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be slaves to the material things of the world, and will not be satisfied.

original: bdag nyid shes bzhin du khyim pas shes par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid dgra bcom pa yin par sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid shes bzhin du khyim pas shes par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid dgra bcom pa yin par sgrogs par byed do //
translated: They will be attached to the householders, and will proclaim themselves to be Arhats, even though they are not, so that householders will know it.

original: de dag de ltar shes par byed pa yongs su tshol @70a * //
analyzed: de dag de ltar shes par byed pa yongs su tshol @70a * //
translated: When they seek to be known in this way,

original: ba na / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'dor bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ba na / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'dor bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: they will abandon the Awakening of the Buddhas.

original: gzi brjid can gyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: gzi brjid can gyi mdo las kyang /
translated: The Tejorāśi Sūtra also says:

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la brten pa'i dge slong gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la brten pa'i dge slong gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgur 'gyur te /
translated: There are ninety-nine hundred thousand afflictions of monks who are attached to material things and to being respected.

original: de dag gis mtshams med pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gis mtshams med pa'i sa thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: They will attain the stage of the Avīci hell.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra on Exhortation to Higher Intention also says:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Then the Blessed One said:🔽“Monks, you should not be attached to material things and to being respected.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i skyon ji ltar mthong bar bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i skyon ji ltar mthong bar bgyi /
translated: “Blessed One, how should bodhisattvas see the faults of gain and honor?

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i nongs dmigs ni gang lags /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i nongs dmigs ni gang lags /
translated: What are the disadvantages of gain and honor?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag la brtags na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag la brtags na /
translated: When bodhisattvas examine

original: 'dod pa chung ngu la dga' zhing /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ngu la dga' zhing /
translated: those who delight in few desires

original: yongs su mi gdung bar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: yongs su mi gdung bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: and are not tormented,🔽what do they see?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni 'dod chags bskyed pa yin par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni 'dod chags bskyed pa yin par brtag par bya'o //
translated: “Maitreya, bodhisattva mahāsattvas should examine gain and honor as producing attachment.

original: rnyed pa dang bskur sti ni dran pa 'joms par brtag par bya'o //🔽rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pas khengs pa dang dud par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bskur sti ni dran pa 'joms par brtag par bya'o // rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pas khengs pa dang dud par brtag par bya'o //
translated: Gain and honor should be examined as destroying mindfulness.🔽Gain and honor should be examined as causing arrogance and depression due to gain and non-gain.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni gti mug skyed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni gti mug skyed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: Gain and honor should be examined as producing delusion.
